abstract.text: This article provides the list of steps that need to be followed to integrate the GCCardReader framework into an app.

inlineContent.text: Add a frameworks folder into the project and add GCCardReader.framework and NFCReader.framework into it.
Add both of these frameworks into the project as dependencies and select “Embed and sign” for both.

Install MLKit dependencies which are being used internally by our framework with cocoapods. ‘GoogleMLKit/FaceDetection’ and ‘GoogleMLKit/TextRecognition’ should be sufficient for adding all dependencies.
Add the ‘Privacy - NFC Scan Usage Description’, ‘Privacy - Camera Usage Description’, ‘ISO7816 application identifiers for NFC Tag Reader Session’ and ‘AppLicenseKey’ to the app’s info.plist file.
Add the Near Field Communication Tag Reading capability in the ‘Signing and Capabilities’ section of the app.
Import the GCCardReader framework into the required and the public functions for scanning NFC and scanning back of EIDA can be used.

abstract.text: GCCardReader is a framework used for the scanning of emirates ID cards using either the NFC capability or perform OCR with the camera and then validate the result using the ICA API.
